newsitem.title: UK: Christopher hopes French will support Iraq plan.
newsitem.headline: Christopher hopes French will support Iraq plan.

text.p: U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher said on Thursday he hoped France, cool towards two U.S. missile strikes on Iraq this week, would support any future action against Baghdad.

After meeting British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind, Christopher told reporters that Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein should realise further "repressive" actions against Kurds in the north of Iraq would be punished.

Christopher flies to Paris after his one-hour meeting with Rifkind."I hope that after our conversations this afternoon the French will go forward with the operations as we have had in the past," Christopher said.

The U.S. fired a total of 44 cruise missiles on Iraq on Tuesday and Wednesday on air defence targets in southern Iraq to minimise Iraqi resistance to its warplanes policing an expanded no-fly zone in southern Iraq.

"I think we have brought home to Saddam Hussein that there is a very high price for the kind of repressive conduct that he has taken in northern Iraq and that will continue to be the standard by which we measure our actions," Christopher said.
